description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Clinical Trials Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As part of the AI Healthcare team, our focus is on high-impact problems that have recently become tractable with the advent of Deep Learning.

As a Clinical Trials Manager, you will be an integral team member. Your understanding of the healthcare landscape, requirements, and challenges will enable you to work hand-in-hand with our Product and Research teams to design and develop scalable solutions and take them to market.

The objective is to design, launch, and manage advanced studies with our teams. You will also be interfacing with our Product and Research teams to enable high throughput data-flows.

You're an experienced professional, comfortable with expertly navigating clinical research and regulatory requirements connected to established clinical trial standards. You have demonstrated knowledge of regulations, organizational management, and large multidisciplinary cohort studies, and you have a track record of delivering complex studies with cross-functional teams.

There is always more information out there, and the Research and Machine Intelligence team has a never-ending quest to find it and make it accessible. We're constantly refining our signature search engine to provide better results, and developing offerings like Google Instant, Google Voice Search and Google Image Search to make it faster and more engaging. We're providing users around the world with great search results every day, but at Google, great just isn't good enough. We're just getting started.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Master's degree or clinical degree in life sciences or related healthcare field (e.g., RN, RNP, APNP degree).
  • 15 years of work experience at a pharmaceutical, biotech, CRO (Contract Research Organization), medical device company, or academic medical center.
  • Experience with approaches and technologies for QSR and ISO Compliance.
  • Experience leading clinical studies through full life cycle.

Preferred qualifications:

  • PhD, Doctor of Medicine (MD), or Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) degree.
  • Experience as a member on an Institutional Review Board, Data Safety Monitoring Boards, and/or academic study sessions.
  • Experience with global vendor selection and implementation strategies.
  • Experience in strategizing submissions for legal and compliance approvals.
  • Understanding of current trends of healthcare and/or life science governance for clinical trials.
responsibilities:
• Provide clinical trial domain expertise in supporting managerial relationships with Google’s partners, including business leadership, scientific leadership, study design, and the enablement of test beds allowing for studies and publications.
  • Recommend regulatory strategies, create new policies, and develop artifacts for Clinical Research stakeholders using best practices.
  • Own the research relationship with Google’s partners, including managing study briefings, site evaluation, and the coordination of additional technical, operational, and delivery resources.
  • Travel 30% of the time to partner sites, conferences, and other related events as required.
  • Lead, both independently and collaboratively, with cross-functional teams toward strategic interests.
title: Clinical Trials Manager, AI Healthcare
